location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Docket enclosing paragraph 2 of Resolution no.562 passed by Government

mods.abstract: The docket and its enclosure relate to the opium trade in the Persian Gulf. The enclosure, an extract of paragraph 2 of Resolution no.562, dated 29 January 1853, notes that opium is grown in the northern parts of Asia Minor and Persia, and shipped at Constantinople [Istanbul] in the vessels of the Peninsular and Oriental Company, transferred at Malta for Alexandria, and then conveyed via the Suez Canal to Singapoor [Singapore] and China.
